text:
Problem 2.1

What's the Story?: Interpreting Graphs

Information about variables is often shown with coordinate graphs or tables. So it is important to be good at reading the “story” in a graph or table. Here are some questions to ask when we look at a graph or table.

What are the variables?

Do the values of one variable seem to depend on the values of the other?

What does the shape of the graph or arrangement in a table say about the relationship between the variables?

In this problem, we look more closely at relationships represented in graphs.
